alert.note: Alert for Decatur; Graham; Norton (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 18 at 3:07AM CST until January 19 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT FRIDAY NIGHT TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 25 below zero. * WHERE...In Kansas, Decatur, Norton and Graham Counties. In Nebraska, Red Willow County. * WHEN...For the first Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Friday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from midnight Friday night to noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Wind chills will be coldest near sunrise.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
